{"step_by_step_thinking": "The researchers are trying to evaluate how often HIV is related to high-risk behaviors in a specific population, which is female sex workers. They are not following up with the participants over time, so they are not measuring the incidence or hazard rate. They are also not comparing the risk of HIV in female sex workers to the risk in a different group, so they are not measuring the attributable risk. Therefore, they are likely measuring the prevalence of HIV in this population, which is the proportion of a population who have a specific characteristic (in this case, HIV) at a specific point in time.", "answer_choice": "B. Prevalence"}
